1.task: Make your bed
Go around your house and pick up all the dishes and drinking glasses on your nightstand and coffee table.
Trim your toe nails.
Clean off your computer desktop.
Wipe off your bathroom mirror
Open all the mail and envelopes you know aren’t important
Pull in your trash, recycling, and compost bins from the curb.
Plug in your phone and charge it.
Take that pile of shoes by the front door (or under the coffee table) and put them where they belong.
Wash that plate or cereal bowl instead of putting it in the sink
Take all the receipts and papers and bags out of your car.
Back up your computer.
Wipe off the front of your refrigerator or oven
Send that one email reply you’ve been avoiding
Clean the coffee pot or toss the filter and grounds now, not later.
Floss. Your. Teeth.
Go through your text messages and make sure you’ve actually replied to the important ones, not just replied in your head
Invite your spouse or partner for some intimate time later.
Microwave a bowl of half white vinegar and half water for one minute
Clean out your browser tabs
Replenish your toilet paper reserves
Throw all your dirty clothes in the hamper or a laundry basket.
Water your plants.
Stack up books, magazines, records, DVDs, library media, etc, that you’re currently enjoying.
Switch out your bathroom towels
Take your vitamins
Look away from the computer screen
Refill your soap dispensers.
Stand up, take a walk
Put on sunscreen.
Smile. Really, really big
Fluff and straighten the pillows on your sofa
Download current episodes of your favorite podcasts
Tell somebody you love them.
Do 30 pushups.
Take all the coats and jackets off hooks and back of the door and hang them up in the closet.
Shake out door mats and bathroom rugs
Sweep underneath the toe kick on your kitchen cabinets
Wrap and coil up your cables, headphones, and power cords
Close your eyes and breathe deeply for 60 seconds.
Do 20 pushups
Drink a glass of water
Check your todo list

2.task: Tell a loved one you appreciate them
Write in a journal
Pay someone a compliment
Affirm your goals for the year
Tidy up your workspace
Complete 10 jumping jacks
Catch your breath by working on mindful breathing
Save a contact on your phone
Answer 5 emails
Delete 5 junk emails
Pick up toys
Just ate? Wash your dish or put it in the dishwasher
Toss laundry in the machine
Take out the garbage
Eat a banana or piece of fruit
Read the first page of a new book
Set a reminder on your phone to complete a goal or task you're likely to forget
Make your bed
Trim your nails
Wipe off the bathroom sink after brushing your teeth
Check the mail and throw out junk letters
Back up your computer
Throw out the coffee filter and grounds you left in the coffee maker this morning
Floss
Microwave a bowl of 1/2 white vinegar, 1/2 water for one minute, then wipe the grime away
Throw dirty clothes in the hamper
Clean out your open browser tabs or bookmarks
Water the plants
Take a daily vitamin
Smile as wide as you can
Have a wifi connection? Download your favorite podcasts or Netflix shows so you can watch while you're offline
Smack the doormats and bathroom rugs against something
Text your mom
Driving? Plugin your phone to charge while you commute
Create a grocery list and add to it when needed
Brush your teeth
Plan your next day
Slow down and catch your breath
Test all the pens in your bag or on your desk
Delete apps you rarely use from your smartphone
Look through your Downloads folder and file or delete any files you can

4.task: Unsubscribe from any newsletters that aren't helping you achieve your goals
Update a few bullets on your resume
Read a few pages of a book

5.task: Read a few pages of a book
Review your calendar
Affirm your goals
Quick stretch
Unsubscribe from any newsletters that aren't helping you achieve your goals
Update a few bullets on your resume
Change the password to your email account(s)
Review your schedule for the next day
Delete items from your computer’s recycling or trash bin
Clean your eyeglasses, reading glasses, or sunglasses
Unsubscribe from an email list or newsletter you no longer wish to receive
Make a grocery list for the week
Clear your internet browser’s cache
Brainstorm gift ideas for a friend or family member’s birthday.
Assemble an outfit for tomorrow
Clean a dirty mirror
Sit quietly to collect your thoughts or to relax
Change a lightbulb
Write a thank you note or email
Shine a pair of dress shoes
Update an app on your smartphone, tablet, laptop, or desktop
Dust a piece of furniture
Clear the sink drainboard or unload the dishwasher
Check your bank account balance
Scrub the kitchen or bathroom sink
Open the windows to air out a stuffy room or office
Fill out an appliance rebate or warranty application
Vacuum a small rug or section of carpet
Replace batteries in a remote control or other device
Take out the trash or recycling
Change the toner cartridge(s) in a printer or photocopier
Recycle broken or damaged umbrellas
Charge an electronic device or two
Donate money to a favorite charity or organization
Restock office supplies at your desk
Pay a bill online or by phone
Sort through the day’s postal mail
Delete an unused app from your smartphone or computer
Make your bed
Throw away expired foods and condiments from your refrigerator
Redeem a gift card online by purchasing a good or service
Place dirty clothes in the hamper or washing machine
Check your credit score
Add your vacation days to your calendar or planner
Update your LinkedIn profile or resume
Wipe down a countertop or table
Check the expiration date of your driver’s license, passport, or visa
Polish a small piece of silver jewelry
Shred a stack of papers
Schedule your next haircut appointment
Read a brief magazine article
Vacuum or use a pressurized air canister to clean your computer’s keyboard
Go outside for a quick walk and a breath of fresh air
Refill paper in a printer or photocopier
Delete old texts and voicemail messages
Gather clothes to drop off at the dry cleaner’s
Write a letter to a family member
Breathe deeply. Seriously. For five whole minutes
Do 15 pushups or 30 lunges. Feel the burn!
Update the to-do list. Don’t have one? Well, take five minutes and make one
Put on your power jam and dance (That's 30 calories for five minutes of dancing!)!
Clean out the junk drawer
Enjoy a cup of coffee
Play with your dog or cat. It relieves stress—and your pet loves you for it!
Write two non-work related emails
Go through that stack of business cards, toss the ones you don’t need
Make the bed. You’ll feel like a real grownup
Delete unread (at least 14 days) emails. You are NEVER going to read them
Vacuum one room
Dust one shelf
